statement: Prove that the limit of (1 + 1/n)^n as n approaches infinity equals e. Use the definition of e as the sum of the infinite series.
solution_sketch: Use the binomial theorem to expand (1 + 1/n)^n. Show that as n -> infinity, this converges to the series sum_{k=0}^âˆž 1/k!. Use the definition of e^x and show e^1 = e.
